data: Alick Craven, who was something in the Foreign Office, had been living in London, except for an interval of military service during the war, for several years, and had plenty of interesting friends and acquaintances, when one autumn day, in a club, Francis Braybrooke, who knew everybody, sat down beside him and began, as his way was, talking of people.
browsing: culture/civilization/society|browsing: crime/mystery|browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: novels|category: british literature
